name: Alloy Legs
notes:
Notes
A lesser variant of the Grasshopper Legs. It weighs 13.0 oz more, as well as having one less armor.

name: Bast Legs
notes:
Notes
Part of the Jungle Set.

name: Bast Skirt
notes:
Notes
Mostly used for decoration. Since the Summer Update 2006 they have become quite valuable because they are required in a quest which correspond with many other quests.3 are needed for The Sweaty Cyclops Quest.It can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: Blue Legs
notes:
Notes
They have the same armor as Knight Legs and Crown Legs, but are considerably lighter. Since the 8.4 Update, these are a valuable piece of armor for mid-level mages, until they can afford to purchase Lightning Legs, Terra Legs, Magma Legs, or Glacier Kilt. Most mid-high players use them because of their low weight and high armor.

Obtained in the Koshei the Deathless Quest.

name: Brass Legs
notes:
Notes
Part of the  Brass and Noob Set. Useful for lower levels. They can be gotten by unrusting Heavily Rusted Legs, Rusted Legs and Slightly Rusted Legs. Knights can also get these legs on the Island of Destiny and in Dawnport. Due to a bug, the legs were also briefly brought to Rookgaard from Dawnport. 
Can be obtained in the Troll Cave Quest.

name: Broken Iks Faulds
notes:
Notes
This item is one of the four required to obtain the first addon for the Ancient Aucar Outfits.

name: Chain Legs
notes:
Notes
Only few people use these legs, they are one of the weakest legs in Main and most low levels use Brass Legs. They are part of the Chain Set. They can be gotten by unrusting Heavily Rusted Legs and Rusted Legs.

name: Chocolatey Dragon Scale Legs
notes:
Notes
It was introduced to celebrate Tibia's 20th Anniversary.Despite what its name might suggest, this item is not edible.

name: Crown Legs
notes:
Notes
Part of the strong and expensive Crown Set. Similar to Knight Legs in armor, but significantly more expensive because of the rarity of Crown Legs and because they are 5.00 oz lighter.
Since the 8.1 Update the Blue Legs have seemed to replace the Crown Legs thus making the Crown Legs harder to sell and drop in value. These can be gotten by unrusting Rusted Legs and Slightly Rusted Legs.

Needed for an addon of Wizard Outfits.

name: Dawnfire Pantaloons
notes:
Notes
It's part of the Naga Set.

name: Demon Legs
notes:
Notes
This is the third best leg armor by weight and armorpower, and the second best by armorpower. Before Update 8.2 these were unobtainable and therefore a extremely exclusive item, however, after 8.2 these became a reward for a new quest, making the value and rarity drop a lot.
This quest had a lot of controversy, because many felt that making the Demon Legs a quest reward would destroy a piece of Tibia history. Since they are heavier than Golden Legs they are now more commonly used as a house decoration.
Obtainable in The Demon Oak Quest.

name: Depth Ocrea
notes:
Notes
Part of the Depth Set. These are, together with Porcelain Mask, Witch Hat and Starlight Vial, one of the equipment with permanent protection against Mana Drain.

name: Dragon Scale Legs
notes:
Notes
They were the legs with the highest defense rating in Tibia until the introduction of the Falcon Greaves. These are unobtainable and thus very rare. It is shown at Tibian Exhibitions. They can also be seen in the Kazordoon Treasure Room and the Beregar Treasure Room. Part of the Dragon Set.

name: Dwarven Legs
notes:
Notes
They have the same armor as Plate Legs but are 1 oz lighter and also improves physical resistance whilst worn. This legs can block the same physical damage as Golden Legs but only if you gets physical hits of 67 or more, so you will have to fight stronger monsters to make this legs block as good as Golden Legs. Part of the Dwarven Set.
Obtainable through The Hidden City of Beregar Quest - The Royal Rescue.

name: Eldritch Breeches
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Elven Legs
notes:
Notes
It look the same as Ranger Legs.

name: Exotic Legs
notes:
Notes
Part of the Jungle Set.

name: Fabulous Legs

attributes.Attributes: distance fighting +2, sword fighting +2, axe fighting +2, club fighting +2

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Falcon Greaves

attributes.Attributes: distance fighting +3, sword fighting +3, club fighting +3, axe fighting +3

notes:
Notes
The second-best legs in the game for Knights and Paladins, though they fall just short of the Sanguine legs/greaves. These remain the top choice for Knights and Paladins between levels 300 and 499. Due to its very high price its value in gold greatly depends on the Tibia Coins market in the Game World.

name: Gill Legs
notes:
Notes
Part of the Gill Set.

name: Glacier Kilt
notes:
Notes
It gives 6% protection from Ice Damage, but increases damage taken from Energy by 6%. It's part of the Glacier Set.

name: Gnome Legs
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Golden Legs
notes:
Notes
One of the best obtainable legs in Tibia. Its price has dropped considerably after the last few updates, since both Zaoan Legs and Dwarven Legs (if you get physical hits of 56 or more) are better. Since update 8.2 these legs have surpassed the Demon Legs due to weight and price. They can be gotten by Slightly Rusted Legs.

name: Grasshopper Legs
notes:
Notes
Very sought after by sorcerers and druids, so they will sell for much higher than the NPC price. A lesser variant would be the Alloy Legs, designed for a lower level audience. See also: Speed Set

name: Green Demon Legs
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Icy Culottes
notes:
Notes
Much better than a Glacier Kilt, which has a level restriction (40+), 2% less ice protection and -6% energy protection. The rarity and the stats makes it a very valuable item.

name: Knight Legs
notes:
Notes
Fourth strongest legs of Tibia, commonly used by Knights of level 30+. They can also be attained by removing rust from Rusted Legs and Slightly Rusted Legs.

name: Leaf Legs
notes:
Notes
Elegant legs made of leaves, they are reasonably rare and a fine decoration. For many people these legs are valuable. It was first seen on June 1, 2009.  See also: Dryad Set

name: Leather Legs
notes:
Notes
One of the first items you'll own.Looks the same as Smelly Leather Legs.

name: Lederhosen
notes:
Notes
Part of the Traditional Set.
Obtained by facing the Orger Treasure for the first time in your first edition of Orcsoberfest.

name: Legs of Enlightenment
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Lightning Legs
notes:
Notes
They used to be dropped by Warlock, but nowadays it is very hard to loot these legs. They give 6% protection from Energy Damage, but increase damage taken from Earth by 6%. They are part of the Lightning Set.

name: Magma Legs
notes:
Notes
They give 6% protection from Fire Damage, but increase damage taken from Ice by 6%. They are part of the Magma Set.

name: Mammoth Fur Shorts
notes:
Notes
They are very light, but there is no real reason to wear them since they have no armor; collectors or people using this item for decoration may buy them.

name: Midnight Sarong
notes:
Notes
It's part of the Naga Set.

name: Mutant Bone Kilt
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Mutated Skin Legs
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Ornate Legs
notes:
Notes
They were the best legs available in game until the implementation of the Falcon Greaves. Nevertheless, it's still the best legs for Knights between the levels 185 and 300 and much cheaper than the Falcon Greaves. Part of the Ornate Set.

name: Pirate Knee Breeches
notes:
Notes
A part of the Pirate Set.

Needed for the Meriana Quest.

name: Plate Legs
notes:
Notes
These legs are used by most low level Tibians. They can also be obtained by removing the rust from Heavily Rusted Legs, Rusted Legs and Slightly Rusted Legs. They are part of the Plate Set and useful to all vocations at a low level.

name: Prismatic Legs
notes:
Notes
Part of the Prismatic Set.

name: Ranger Legs
notes:
Notes
There was a rumor that they had been obtained on Elysia many years ago but it's not confirmed (The image used for the Ranger legs is the same used for Dragon Scale Legs from earlier years of Tibia, confirmed by Degerdi who owned a pair on Nova before 2004). This item is obtained by choosing Paladin vocation on the Island of Destiny (it is looted from a chest in the reward room underneath Paladin Narai). They are somewhat a rarity on mainland, since they cannot be bought from NPC's.

name: Sanguine Greaves

attributes.Augments: Avatar of Light -> -900s cooldown, Divine Caldera -> 8% critical extra damage

notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet, which can be looted from any boss in the 4 areas of the Rotten Blood Quest if some conditions are met. Can also be obtained through a Crimson Offering.

name: Sanguine Legs

attributes.Augments: Avatar of Steel -> -900s cooldown, Fierce Berserk -> +8% critical extra damage
attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +4, axe fighting +4, club fighting +4

notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet, which can be looted from any boss in the 4 areas of the Rotten Blood Quest if some conditions are met. Can also be obtained through a Crimson Offering.

name: Soulful Legs
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Soulshanks
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Legs for Sorcerers in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Soulstrider
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Legs for Druids in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Stitched Mutant Hide Legs

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +2, axe fighting +2, club fighting +2

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Stoic Iks Culet

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +2, axe fighting +2, club fighting +2

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Stoic Iks Faulds

attributes.Augments: Great Energy Beam -> +7% Base Damage, Great Death Beam -> +7% Base Damage

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Studded Legs
notes:
Notes
As the strongest defensive legs in Rookgaard, they can be valued highly. Part of the Studded Set. They can be gotten by unrusting Heavily Rusted Legs and Rusted Legs.
Can be obtained on Rookgaard in the Studded Legs Quest.

name: Tatty Dragon Scale Legs
notes:
Notes
You can dig tatty dragon scale legs at Vigintia's treasure hunting zone.It was introduced to celebrate Tibia's 20th Anniversary.

name: Terra Legs
notes:
Notes
They give 6% protection from Earth Damage but increase damage taken from Fire by 6%. Part of the Terra Set.

name: Trousers of the Ancients
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Doctor Perhaps to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. It's the lightest of all Legs.
Looks the same as a Fern.

There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Wereboar Loincloth
notes:
Notes
Is mostly used by low level mages, because they have a low weight.
Are replaced by the Blue Legs when they can be obtained.

name: Yalahari Leg Piece
notes:
Notes
Their +2 to distance makes them the best legs at the moment, sharing the title with Prismatic Legs. However, due to physical's prevalence, Prismatic Legs may be more useful. Thus, Yalahari Leg Piece becomes situational when Prismatic Legs become usable.
Part of the Yalahari Set.
Obtained through the In Service of Yalahar Quest.

name: Zaoan Legs
notes:
Notes
It is disputed whether Zaoan Legs or Dwarven Legs are the best obtainable leg-pieces, except for Knights of level 185 who can wear Ornate Legs. Part of the Zaoan Set. See also: Armor Protection Comparison¬†and Calculators#Armor
